page.title: 04OLD WARDOUR CASTLE.
page.content: {Old Wardour Castle}was built in{1393 and{13000}people visit it each year.In the{Civil War}the castle was beseiged by{Sir Edward Hungerford,}a {Parlimentarian}with{1300 men.}There were merely{25 fighting men}in the castle.They held out for{7 days.}Later it was beseiged by the{Royalists.}That seige lasted for{ten months.}The damage was never repaired.{The grotto was built in the{18th century}at the same time as the{New Castle}about one kilometre away. The lakes were made at the same time.The Old Castle was over 4 storeys high.{The frost, the {pigeons and the weather}make the castle crumble and sag a bit but it is not in danger of falling down. There is scaffolding up around the castle at the moment. {John}and{Stephen.
